texto: practical solutions; b) there is a hierarchical or other relationship between system elements; c) an entity at any level in the system‐of‐interest can be viewed as a system; d) a system comprises an integrated, defined set of subordinate system elements; e) humans can be viewed as both users external to a system and as system elements (i.e., operators) within a system; and f) a system can be viewed in isolation as an entity, i.e., a product; or as a collection of functions capable of interacting with its surrounding environment, i.e., a set of services.
